summary: This bill, H.R. 47, the "VOICE Restoration Act," proposes to re-establish the Victims of Immigration Crime Engagement (VOICE) Office within U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE). The office, originally created in 2017 and terminated in 2021, is designed to support victims of crimes committed by non-citizens present in the U.S. without lawful status. Its duties include providing victim-centered support, offering a toll-free hotline, connecting victims with social services, and assisting with custody status notifications for offenders. The bill also mandates the office to publish quarterly reports to Congress and the President.
